workforce housing that is:
● Cost-effective: 55% reduction in construction time and labor costs
● Energy-efficient: 60% savings on heating/cooling costs benefit both owners and tenants
● Durable: Superior structural performance and weather resistance
● Scalable: Factory manufacturing allows consistent quality and faster delivery
Economic and Social Impact: Workforce housing development addresses documented market
needs while providing:
● Economic development tool for employer recruitment and retention
● Stable rental income stream for investors
● Property tax revenue for municipal services
● Improved quality of life and reduced cost burden for working families
The convergence of documented housing need, innovative construction technology, and
available financing mechanisms creates an optimal environment for workforce housing
development in Hattiesburg. This represents not speculative development, but a response to
clearly demonstrated market demand supported by comprehensive data analysis.
